intro: Betulaster nitida, commonly known as the slender buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its slender, often multi-branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by small, berry-like fruits. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a serrated margin. Betulaster nitida is often found in rocky or sandy soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
